org.mt4j.util.math
Class Tools3D

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.util.math.Tools3D

public class Tools3D
extends java.lang.Object

Class containing mostly static convenience utility methods.

Author:
Christopher Ruff

static void beginDrawOnTopStayOnScreen(processing.core.PApplet pa)
          Start drawing in on TOP of everything drawn previously, also resets the camera, so that something drawn at 0,0,0 will be drawn at the top left corner of the screen regardless of the camera used You could say this allows you to draw directly on the screen, and on top of everything else.

unprojectScreenCoords

public static Vector3D unprojectScreenCoords(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                                             Icamera camera,
                                             float screenX,
                                             float screenY)
Unprojects screen coordinates from 2D into 3D world space and returns a point that can be used to construct a ray form the camera to that point and check for intersections with objects.

NOTE: if using openGL mode, the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
applet - the applet
camera - the camera
screenX - the screen x
screenY - the screen y
Returns:
the vector3d

unprojectScreenCoords

public static Vector3D unprojectScreenCoords(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                                             float screenX,
                                             float screenY)
Unprojects screen coordinates from 2D into 3D world space and returns a point that can be used to construct a ray form the camera to that point and check for intersections with objects.

NOTE: if using openGL mode, the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
applet - processings PApplet object
screenX - x coordinate on the screen
screenY - y coordinate on the screen
Returns:
a point that lies on the line from the screen coordinates to the 3d world coordinates

                                   IMTComponent3D component,
                                   float screenX,
                                   float screenY)

NOTE: the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

applet - the applet
component - the component
screenX - the screen x
screenY - the screen y

the pick ray

projectGL

public static Vector3D projectGL(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                                 javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu,
                                 Vector3D point)
Projects the given point to screenspace.
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the current viewport, model and projection matrices.

NOTE: the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
gl - the gl
glu - the glu
point - the point to project to the screen
Returns:
the vector3 d

projectGL

public static Vector3D projectGL(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                                 javax.media.opengl.glu.GLU glu,
                                 Vector3D point,
                                 Vector3D store)
Projects the given point to screenspace.
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the current viewport, model and projection matrices.
Note: this method has to be called between a call to processingApplet.beginGL() and processingApplet.endGL()

NOTE: the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
gl - the gl
glu - the glu
point - the point
store - the store - vector to store the result in or null to get a new vector
Returns:
the vector3 d

project

public static Vector3D project(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                               Icamera cam,
                               Vector3D point)
Projects the given 3D point to screenspace.
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the supplied camera, viewport, and projection matrices. The modelview is temporarily changed to match the supplied camera matrix.

Parameters:
applet - the applet
cam - the cam
point - the point
Returns:
the vector3 d

project

public static Vector3D project(processing.core.PApplet applet,
                               Vector3D point)
Projects the given point to screenspace. Uses the current modelview, and projection matrices - so update them accordingly before calling!
Shows where on the screen the point in 3d-Space will appear according to the current viewport, model and projection matrices.

NOTE: if using openGL mode, the openGL context has to be valid at the time of calling this method.

Parameters:
applet - the applet
point - the point
Returns:
a new projected vector3d

beginDrawOnTopStayOnScreen

public static void beginDrawOnTopStayOnScreen(processing.core.PApplet pa)
Start drawing in on TOP of everything drawn previously, also resets the camera, so that something drawn at 0,0,0 will be drawn at the top left corner of the screen regardless of the camera used You could say this allows you to draw directly on the screen, and on top of everything else. (at the near clipping plane?) NOTE: you have to CALL endDrawOnTopStayOnScreen() if finished!

Parameters:
pa - the pa

endDrawOnTopStayOnScreen

public static void endDrawOnTopStayOnScreen(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                            Icamera camera)
Stop drawing in 2D after calling begin2D().

Parameters:
pa - the pa
camera - the camera

disableDepthBuffer

public static void disableDepthBuffer(processing.core.PGraphics g)
Allows to draw ontop of everything, regardless of the values in the z-buffer. To stop doing that, call endDrawOnTop(PApplet pa) .

Parameters:
g - the g

restoreDepthBuffer

public static void restoreDepthBuffer(processing.core.PGraphics g)
End draw on top.

Parameters:
g - the g

generateDisplayLists

public static int[] generateDisplayLists(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                         GeometryInfo geometryInfo,
                                         boolean useTexture,
                                         processing.core.PImage texture,
                                         StyleInfo styleInfo)
Creates 2 displaylists for drawing static geometry very fast. Returns the IDs (names) of the display lists generated with the given info.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
geometryInfo - the geometry info
useTexture - the use texture
texture - the texture
styleInfo - the style info
Returns:
the int[] Returns the IDs (names) of the display lists generated with the given info.

generateDisplayLists

public static int[] generateDisplayLists(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                         int fillDrawMode,
                                         GeometryInfo geometryInfo,
                                         boolean useTexture,
                                         processing.core.PImage texture,
                                         boolean drawSmooth,
                                         float strokeWeight)
Returns the IDs (names) of the display lists generated with the given info.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
fillDrawMode - the fill draw mode
geometryInfo - the geometry info
useTexture - the use texture
texture - the texture
drawSmooth - the draw smooth
strokeWeight - the stroke weight
Returns:
int[2] array where [0] is the list of the fill and [1] the list of the outline drawing list

drawFilledBezierShape

public static void drawFilledBezierShape(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                         Vertex[] vertexArr)
Draws a filled 2d bezier shape in immediate mode with help of the stencil buffer to allow concave geometry. Beziervertices are allowerd in the vertex array.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
vertexArr - the vertex arr

getCubicBezierVertices

public static Vertex[] getCubicBezierVertices(float px0,
                                              float py0,
                                              float bx1,
                                              float by1,
                                              float b2x2,
                                              float b2y2,
                                              float p2x3,
                                              float p2y3,
                                              int segments,
                                              float xx0,
                                              float yy0,
                                              float xx1,
                                              float yy1)
Calculates the vertices of a bezier curve defined by the startpoint p, the controlpoints b,b2 and the end point p2. The segments parameter defines the resolution of the curve

Parameters:
px0 - the px0
py0 - the py0
bx1 - the bx1
by1 - the by1
b2x2 - the b2x2
b2y2 - the b2y2
p2x3 - the p2x3
p2y3 - the p2y3
segments - the segments
xx0 - the xx0
yy0 - the yy0
xx1 - the xx1
yy1 - the yy1
Returns:
the cubic bezier vertices

getCubicFromQuadraticCurve

public static BezierVertex getCubicFromQuadraticCurve(Vertex bezierStart,
                                                      Vertex firstQuadControlP,
                                                      Vertex quadEndPoint)
Converts the values of a quadric bezier curve into a cubic.
Returns a BezierVertex with the values of the cubic curve equivalent to the quadric curve. Creates 2 controlpoints out of one.

Parameters:
bezierStart - the bezier start
firstQuadControlP - the first quad control p
quadEndPoint - the quad end point
Returns:
the cubic from quadratic curve

getQuadBezierVertices

public static Vertex[] getQuadBezierVertices(Vertex curveStartP,
                                             Vertex curveControlP,
                                             Vertex curveEndP,
                                             int segmentDetail)
Calculates the vertices of a quadric bezier curve defined by the startpoint curveStartP, the controlpoint curveControlP and the end point curveEndP.
The segments parameter defines the resolution of the curve.
Note: This method uses only the X and Y Coordinates and generates a 2D curve!

Parameters:
curveStartP - the curve start p
curveControlP - the curve control p
curveEndP - the curve end p
segmentDetail - the segment detail
Returns:
the quad bezier vertices

containsBezierVertices

public static boolean containsBezierVertices(Vertex[] originalPointsArray)
Checks whether the supplied vertex array contains BezierVertex instances.

Parameters:
originalPointsArray - the original points array
Returns:
true, if contains bezier vertices

arcTo

public static java.util.List<Vertex> arcTo(float fromX1,
                                           float fromX2,
                                           float rx,
                                           float ry,
                                           float phi,
                                           boolean large_arc,
                                           boolean sweep,
                                           float x,
                                           float y,
                                           int segments)
Returns an arraylist of vertices that form the arc, built from the supplied parameters.

Parameters:
fromX1 - curve startpointX
fromX2 - curve startpointY
rx - the x radius
ry - the y radius
phi - the phi
large_arc - the large_arc
sweep - the sweep
x - the x
y - the y
segments - the resolution of the curve, more segments -> smoother curve -> less performance
Returns:
the list< vertex>

Returns:
true, if is power of two

getNormal

public static Vector3D getNormal(Vector3D v0,
                                 Vector3D v1,
                                 Vector3D v2,
                                 boolean normalize)
Calculates and returns the normal vector of the plane, the 3 given points are lying in. Also normalizes the normal if normalize is set to true.

Parameters:
v0 - the v0
v1 - the v1
v2 - the v2
normalize - the normalize
Returns:
the normal the normal vector

isPoint3DInPlanarPolygon

public static boolean isPoint3DInPlanarPolygon(Vector3D[] polygonVertices,
                                               Vector3D testPoint,
                                               Vector3D polyNormal)
Projects the polygon and and the point to check into 2D and then checks if the given point is inside the shape.
NOTE: The polygon to test has to be planar, meaning that all points must lie int the same plane in 3d space.

Parameters:
testPoint - the test point
polyNormal - the poly normal
polygonVertices - the polygon vertices
Returns:
true, if checks if is point in poly whether the testpoint is inside the planar polygon or not

NOTE: Use this in 2D, this only uses the x, y coordinates of the vectors!.

the polygon center of mass2 d

getPolygonArea2D

public static double getPolygonArea2D(Vector3D[] vertices)
Calculates the area of a 2D polygon using its transformed world coordinates
NOTE: Use this in 2D, this only uses the x, y coordinates of the vectors!
NOTE: works only if the last vertex is equal to the first (polygon is closed correctly). (not confirmed..)
Polygon vertices have to be declared in counter-clockwise order! (or cw..?)

Parameters:
vertices - the vertices
Returns:
the area as double

beginGL

endGL

public static void endGL(processing.core.PApplet pa)

getGL

public static javax.media.opengl.GL getGL(processing.core.PApplet pa)
Gets the openGL context.
NOTE: If you want to invoke any opengl drawing commands (or other commands influencing or depending on the current modelview matrix) you have to call GL Tools3D.beginGL(PApplet pa) instead!
NOTE: the openGL context is only valid and current when the rendering thread is the current thread.
This only gets the opengl context if started in opengl mode using the opengl renderer.

Parameters:
pa - the pa
Returns:
the gL

clamp

public static final float clamp(float x,
                                float low,
                                float high)
Clamps the specified value to the specified limits. If the value is exceeds the lower or upper limit, the value is set to that limit. Else the value stays the same.

Parameters:
x - the x
low - the low
high - the high
Returns:
the float

scaleTextureCoordsForRectModeFromNormalized

public static void scaleTextureCoordsForRectModeFromNormalized(processing.core.PImage texture,
                                                               Vertex[] verts)
For non power of two textures, the texture coordinates have to be in the range from 0..texture_width instead of from 0.0 to 1.0.
So we try to scale the texture coords to the width/height of the texture

Parameters:
texture - the texture
verts - the verts
